description:
My roommates took me here for my birthday and it was AMAZING. Their bread is so soft and comes with butter and a tomato dip. We ordered the cavolini (brussel sprouts), capellini pomodoro, and tortellini alla panna between three people. Their large portion sizes made it the perfect amount of food for us. The capellini was delicious and had just the right amount of sauce and salt to keep it light and flavorful. The tortellini alla panna was my favorite - perfectly al dente and creamy. The cavolini was alright, but a little overcooked for my taste.

The restaurant is small and cozy, and the staff is friendly and hospitable. Our waiter helped us pick a great pinot noir, and gave me a very generous pour for the tasting when he heard it was my birthday.
author: Apoorva A.

description:
I can't say the food was exceptional, especially by San Francisco standards, but the hospitality was truly top notch. At an off hour, with a messy and restless toddler, they were gracious and patient and didn't really bat an eye. For that alone I am grateful.

As for the food, the noodles weren't as great as you might have thought from a place that specializes in pasta, but the red sauce on my son's dish was a cut above. Judging from the smell of garlic wafting through the place, I'd stick to something with that red sauce on it next time.
author: William B.

description:
Asked for frutti de mare without the fettuccini & it was delicious 

The broth had just enough spice to loosen my sinuses & the bread was delicious. Waitstaff was friendly & helpful.
author: Dani S.

description:
I've been disappointed with many of the Italian restaurants in the SF Bay Area. I so fondly remember the delicious food in Rome and in several cities in Sicilia. 

That said we both wanted Italian food. And it is hard to find a place where I can eat much - I'm vegetarian and try to avoid dairy and white flour/grains, sugar. So goodbye pasta, gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, pumpkin ravioli with brown butter, etc., etc.

So, we gave the restaurant a shot. I was resigned to thinking I'd just have some salad and a side vegetable. But, they had a WHOLE WHEAT pasta primavera. It was great. The pasta actually tasted good and the marinara was excellent. The vegetables were well cooked and plentiful- just the way I make it myself. Full of mushrooms, eggplant, broccolini, kale and zucchini. My wife loved her chicken Marsala with a side of farro. She said the sauce was great and it wasn't too salty. 

The started is off with complimentary focaccia with a tomato dip. I just tasted a tiny bit and both were wonderful. We got a side of Caesar and that was fantastic. So was the side of Brussels Sprouts 

All in all a great dining experience. 

Still like this place a lot BUT they should remove pizza from the menu. Got the margherita at iscwas a sog fest. Water from the sauce or something dropped off of it. The crust had absolutely no crispness to it at all. The cheese was plentiful but didn't taste great. When the waiter checked in I told him I was disappointed in the pizza and he said there was something wrong with the oven. So they know they are turning out lousy pizza and they are still serving it and charging for it. Boooooo. Removing a star.
author: Marco M.

description: Best italian food i have ever ate. 5 stars. I ordered the lasaña and was like a layered heaven
author: Juan T.

description:
This is for the food only as we got this meal on Uber eats and did not set foot in the physical restaurant. 

The order case on time and was nice and hot. We ordered the penne gamberi which was penne with broccolini, shrimp, and a lobster cream sauce. The sauce was delicious and the shrimp were a decent size. The broccolini was good but there were too many stems for my liking. 

We also got the tortellini soup and side Caesar salad. The soups broth was tasty. It had a few chunks of beef and a large hard to eat out of the cup leaf of kale. The tortellini itself was my least favorite part of the dish.  She Caesar salad was average but the dressing was not my favorite. 

We also ordered the build your own kids pasta which came with a drink. We got spaghetti with Alfredo sauce. The flavor was good and the portion was decent for only $7. If it wasn't so unhealthy I would definitely order the two pastas again. Next time I would skip the soup and salad.
author: Danielle B.

description:
What Vixi does best is make you feel at home. Their carb concoctions seem like something your mother could have whipped up in the kitchen. Fresh, hot (temperature), and generous in portions. I think most importantly is the hospitality of the staff there. We had a doting server, but in all the best ways.

Can you eat too much carbohydrates? No, you can't. So you gobble up the complimentary bread that's served with this aromatic, savory tamponade. The bread is focaccia-like (perhaps it's focaccia), and should it come straight out of the oven, is warm and fluffy.

The main event was the bolognese for me, which was the rigatoni pasta, al dente as it should be no other way, in a ground pork and beef tomato sauce with (visible) crimini mushroom. The flavor was bold and kept the palette excited.

The entire dinner party covered most of their pasta menu as well as the salmon, and there were smiles all around.
author: Cici T.

description: I have eaten at Vixi and I have also done a to go order. When I ate in the restaurant, it was on a week night and it was pretty quiet. However, they do a lot of to go orders and deliveries. I have actually never seen a crowd at Vixi. The last time I was there, my dad and I ordered the Bolognese ($15), Fettucini fungi ($15), and the side order of the Caesar salad ($5). The portions were huge compared to when I made a to go order of the Bolognese. It was delicious, but not amazing. The meal also came with a pre-appetizer of focaccia with a tomato dip (1 piece per person) and it's actually really good. To me, it's more memorable than the pasta. You also get the focaccia when you get a delivery or meal to go. Overall, if you're looking for a very straightforward pasta dish to satisfy your pasta craving, Vixi is the spot.
author: Victoria H.

description: Uber Eats delivery, and there is a piece of  METAL in my pasta, I almost swallow it! I assumed it's the debris from metal scrub brush? This is the second time that my food has inedible foreign object in this restaurant. PLEASE BEWARE!
author: Anne M.

description:
3.5 STARS

I had ordered a salad for our office lunch from another spot, but I needed something with a little bit of meat to supplement it. (A meal without protein feels wrong in my book.) Decided to try Vixi Cucina Italiana on Friday, November 17th. Our delivery order arrived around 12:30pm via Caviar.

I ended up getting the Zuppa Di Tortellini. Braised beef, cheese tortellini, rich chicken broth, and kale, One Piece of Bread ($6 cup). I love brothy soups and this one had lots of flavor. Very beefy even though it was chicken broth. Lots of chunks of beef in the soup. And tortellini. (Though I don't really like tortellini unless it's overstuffed or drowning in sauce. I'm not much of a pasta person.) The soup did it's job and fulfilled that meat element I was missing.

So my one coursed lunch turned into two with Vixi. If you're looking for a beefy appetizer and don't want something too heavy, this soup might hit the spot.
author: Elena N.

description:
I love Vixi,we always bring our babies here and the staff always friendly.
The complimentary bread with tomato sauce is delicious
author: Marcia M.

description:
Was craving pasta while staying over at my friends who lives in Laurel Heights. Vixi Cucina Popped up and was only 0.2 miles away so we decided to give it a try. 

It was a little before 6 when we got there and we were able to get seated immediately. The restaurant is shaped like a rectangle with the kitchen on the right and seats along the left hand side of the wall.

I ordered the Bolognese which was tasty but a tad too salty for me...  I'd give this place another try if I were in the area and wanted pasta, but would definitely order another dish next time.
author: Milton F.

description: The cavatappi here is so good! Corkscrew pasta with sun dried tomatoes, chicken, bacon bits, and a creamy mushroom sauce. The side of focaccia was dry though.
author: Lillian B.

description:
It was my first time getting this food and we had it delivered. 

If you want Fettuccini Alfredo, don't come here. It is $16 for just noodles and white sauce. That is not worth it. You could get it elsewhere that actually puts stuff in it to make it worth the $16. They also don't give that much either. I'm confused why they would price it so high when you can get other dishes with protein or shrimp for the same price. I'd be shocked if someone orders this ever again. 

The two stars are towards the Penne Gamberi. It helped raise this review from 1-star to 2-stars. It is really good and actually worth the $16, so I'd recommend you get anything else besides the Alfredo. 

The bread is really good too.

Just don't get the Alfredo.
author: Allyson L.

description:
This was a last minute decision to go to Vixi for lunch - and what a great decision!!!
My friend ordered the zuppa soup and I ordered the baked rigatoni and Ceasar salad
our server Julie was warm and friendly and the food was awesome. The kind where you take one bite, close your eyes and moan in delight!
Can't wait to come back! We came for the complimentary bread and sauce appetizer and ended up with a wonderful experience!!
author: Eileen A.

description:
As always, I feel like I'm missing the hype on Italian spots. 

Pesto pizza: Could've used a bit more pesto, but the crust was super soft and not burnt, which is always a plus. I added some chicken, which was mostly moist and appropriately salted, but a bit dry in some parts. 3/5.

Carprese: Standard tomato and mozzarella, with large tomatoes and slices of mozzarella topped off with basil strips. I've had more tasty versions of this dish in the past. 3/5.

--

Came back for the cioppino: the dish consisted of a lot of mussels and clams, but not much fish or squid. I still don't understand the appeal of this spot, unfortunately. The stew was quite salty without having too much tomato flavor. 3/5.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I've been here twice, and it's really been a great experience both times. I think this is probably one of the best options for food in the area, but I do love me some pasta.

Both times, I've come around lunchtime on the weekdays, and it never actually seems to be packed. It actually seems to be fairly empty, save for some people who are super-retired, probably because it's a sitdown place and people are always in a rush to get back to work. But really, it's not that slow.

When you come into the restaurant, you're greeted by an open kitchen on your right, and they always seem to have pasta laid out on baking pans which is pretty cool. It's unique at least; someone's making pasta, and it gets me in the mood. To eat pasta. The restaurant itself is clean and not super loud which is nice, and the lighting is also on point.

The waiters are nice but not overbearing, and service is great. I think they hit that perfect sweet spot for caring about you without being annoying. You get bread before your meal with a sweet tomato sauce, which is pretty good, but it's definitely not your traditional marinara. It's probably closer to a sundried tomato jam than anything, but whatever it is, it's good. The bread is nice and soft on the inside with the slightest amount of toastiness on the outside. It's not the best bread ever, but they definitely put some effort into it, which is always much appreciated.

The two times I came here, I ordered the Penne Gamberi and the Fettuccini Funghi. I'd say both probably took about 10-15 minutes to come out.

The Fettuccini Funghi was $16 and probably my favorite of the two. It was a really good size, and came with chicken, mushrooms, Italian sausage, all in a super creamy decadent sauce. There almost aren't words to describe the luxuriousness of this dish, it is pretty much just jaw-droppingly rich. And as I am never on a diet, this was pretty much everything I could have asked for. But even with the super creaminess of this dish, the mushroom flavor is present throughout, which is great because I love mushrooms. 2 warnings about this one though: it is a really heavy meal, and the sausage is pretty salty. But overall, I think this is a must try (if you have the option of falling asleep immediately afterwards).
 
The Penne Gamberi was $17 and came with shrimp and broccolini in a creamy tomato sauce. There was nothing bad about this dish, but I don't know if I would order it again. The sauce had a nice mild seafood flavor about it, and the dish came with a very generous portion of shrimp, maybe like 7 or 8 large shrimps in total? There was one large piece of broccolini on top, and scattered cut up stems throughout the dish, which was a little disappointing. Because who actually likes the stems? It's all about the florets. Overall, I thought this dish was pretty vanilla: pleasant, but for the price I'd probably order something else.

So great service, great ambience, and good food. It is a little bit pricey, and there are a few things that could improve with the food, but even considering that, it's a great option. Especially with a group, I don't think anybody would walk away from here unhappy. I will definitely come back here in the future!
author: Eric Y.

description:
Ordered delivery.

The ricotta and spinach ravioli was heaven. Creamy perfection. 

We'll def be ordering from here again!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Took my daughter and her friends there and as usual received a warm welcome at the door till we got to our table. 
My daughter was visiting from NY and coming from there one should know a lot about Italian food and on the top of she is vegetarian but she ordered Caprese and Gamberi. Warm fresh bread from oven was served with fresh tomatoes paste/olive oil which is very delicious and everyone loved it.
Service was amazing our server Jennifer was very kind and understanding between veg and non veg group of people.
After trying appetizer everyone got comfortable with the menu and we start ordering all kind a stuff cuz now we knew it it will be yummy. This was my 3rd trip to VIXI and I am so happy I took my family there. We all left happy and of course very full
author: Annie A.

description:
Wow, what an amazing place to discover right before the year wraps! 

We were craving Italian and Vixi more than hit the spot.  My wife ordered the ravioli with ricotta and spinach and they were bursting with flavor (that's my wife's description).  I had the fettuccini funghi with a creamy mushroom sauce and loads of sausage and grilled chicken.  It was phenomenal, just nailed it and I could barely stop myself from finishing the generous portion.

Can't wait to try more of their menu!
author: Saminda W.

description:
OMG. I just ordered from Vixi today through UberEats and it was amazing!!!

I had the shrimp penne gamberi and it was perfection.

The cream lobster sauce was so good, I want to bathe in it (not really but still...)

The portion was a great size, with tons of shrimp. Most places are so cheap with the shrimp. I was happy to see more than 7! The brocolli was tasty and the penne was cooked just right.

Even the bread that it came with was amazing. it wasnt that nasty stale ass untasteful bread that most place gives. I think it was fresh foccacia with rosemary. 

I will definitely order again!
author: Tati C.

description:
After a day of hiking with Gina M., we were both beyond starving. In an area that's full of sandwich shops, pizza parlors, and Asian restaurants, it was nice to spot Vixi on my trusty Yelp app. Parking was actually very easy to obtain, and just a short few steps from the restaurant. The inside is small, but cozy. I am a big fan of the kitchen being open, so you can watch the cooks prepare food. I think it's a nice touch that more restaurants should have. We sat in the back, and about a minute after being seated our bread with olive oil arrived. 

The bread was tasty and hot, and the olive oil had a little tomato tapenade in it. The whole thing was quite good, and a great prelude for deliciousness to come. I ordered the Lemon Pepper Chicken, and for my one side I ordered broccolini. The chicken was fantastic. It was both cooked and seasoned perfectly. The broccolini was my favorite part of the meal. It had a very vibrant green hue, and it was mixed with big chunks of garlic, and tossed with pepper flakes. The whole meal just pops out at you. 

As we waited for our meal, I witnessed the most bizarre and blasphemous thing to ever happen to Italian cuisine: An Italian woman and her children, asked for ketchup to slather their pasta and pizza with. I couldn't look away. I know I'm no chef, but in my mind, you use ketchup like you use steak sauce: to slather on something that was not cooked or seasoned right. It just seemed like an insult to the chef, and I was a little shocked. 

Vixi feels like a fancy, Italian restaurant, without the overpriced menu items. They have beautiful local art on the walls, and the wait staff wear shirts with bowtie pasta as bowties, which is too cute. I love this place, and I highly recommend it for anyone any the area looking for taste of Italy.
author: Jonathan R.

description: We were looking for some pasta and soup to warm us up on this brisk summer evening, and oh my.. we are satisfied. I believe Andres was our sever and he provided excellent service. He was attentive and answered all of our questions with no issue. The restaurant was super clean, and I loved the energy in there. We got the minestrone to start, and I loved the broccolini touch in the soup. We split the alfredo and added chicken. It was phenomenal and so creamy. I will definitely return, and I live an hour away.
author: Libby C.

description:
For a log time this used to be a Pasta Pomodoro location. I was a fan of that model, as it provided fast, decent Italian food at good value. Pane Vino was not, but it was pretty good stuff, plus it was a short distance from our house, so I was bummed when it shut down.

In came Vixi, and it was a welcome addition to the neighborhood.  I was thrilled when I stopped there for a quick lunch at the counter. I had the shrimp appetizer, which comes with scrumptious sauce, and toasted, crunchy Italian bread to dunk in it. Yum!

I had the salmon pasta, and it was surprisingly fresh and good. The wine list is simple but to the point, and I washed everything down with a couple of glasses of white wine.

The staff was pleasant and attentive. I will come back.

If you want solid, casual, Italian food in Laurel Heights-Presidio Heights-Inner Richmond, go here.
author: Massimo M.

description:
There are a couple of red flags here.

I believe that 80% of these Yelp reviews (that got this place to a 4.5) are FAKED (and/or friends of the owners) - Many of the earlier 5 stars are reviews are from people with so few reviews (less than 25 reviews total, many n the single digits) its seems coercion is at play here.

Also the menu seems to be an almost exact replica of the Pasta Pomodoro circa 2007, so wondering if the owner was a previous worker.

This place is overrun with the Laurel Heights families (aka LOTS of kids).

We walked in at about 6:ish on a Friday night, were seated immediately in a basically 1/10 full restaurant, with about 3 servers about 5 - 10 feet away doing things like folding napkins but not acknowledging us, at one point I said to my husband - "I am giving it 60 more seconds until we walk out" - After about 10 minutes we were acknowledged by our server.

The food prices are reasonable - but the wine is pricey - cheapest bottle is $35.

Food was okay and the portions were decent, but  (after the cruddy service) I can make the same thing at home for 1/5 the price. Will likely not be back.
author: Amy W.

description:
This spot is one of the best random discoveries I've made in a while. It's so hard to find great Italian these days, especially when you're one of those annoying people like myself whose been to Rome and had all subsequent Italian food ruined for them. I honestly only came here because I was so hungry I was going to faint. That said I had THE most legit plate of Fettuccine Alfredo at the place. There literally are no words you just have to go and try it. 

It's a good thing their food is amazing because their service is terrible. The waitress seemed like she hated her life and barely greeted us, she also never checked back after we got our food and we had to go find her to get our bill at the end. However I would still definitely come back her for the pasta, no smiles needed for me to have a happy tummy.
author: Quisha H.

description: I've been to Vixi's several times but this last visit was a killer.   I had their special,  ribs cooked in wine.  Almost immediately after dinner,  I started to feel unwell.  I spent the whole sleepless night smelling the beef I had,  quite disgusting really,  and having flu like symptoms of chills and a aches.   These,  it turns out,  can be signs of food poisoning.   Needless to say,  I won't be back.
author: Shirley L.

description: This place was delicious!! My husband and I were i town visiting friends and came across this place. Everything from the bread they give, the bruschetta (amazing!!!) and all the entrees we got were delicious. I got the meatballs, which were perfectly cooked! The minestrone was fresh with a lot of veggies, the Cesar salad was refreshing. My husband got some seafood pasta (can't remember the name).. but he about licked the plate clean. The service was also above and beyond, my water glass was never empty (and I suck that dry quickly).. would definitely go back if I was in town again!
author: Kathryn S.

description: My wife and I have gone to Vixa many times for good food, well-prepared, at a reasonable price. Recently we went on a Thursday evening and had a 5-star experience with our server Loretta. She was  - far and away - the best server we have encountered there. Fast, friendly, fun, totally professional . . . she definitely "raised the bar" from a service perspective.
author: Andy E.

description:
Really good Italian at a reasonable price point.

I came in to grab some takeout for my mom.  It was during that quiet (& usually awkward) time in between lunch & dinner.  

But the host (maybe manager) could not have been nicer.

I went w the salmone pasta.  Whole grain fusilli pasta in light tomato sauce w salmon.

The rock star host asked me "green salad or Caesar salad?"

What a surprise.  I said Caesar.

"How about some bread?"

"Sure," I answered w a shrug, thinking that this & the Caesar were going to obviously cost extra.

But, it's for mom.  She's worth it.

Surprise surprise...
They didn't cost extra!

When my order was ready, which was only 15 minutes or so, the host did refer to me as "young lady."  This only succeeded in scoring even more points for him.  
It is that easy.

Fresh & flavorful.  The side Caesar could be a small meal all by itself.  And the bread is fresh focaccia bread, instead of the usual, borderline stale, baguette variety.  AND, it's served w a tomato tapenade for dipping.

All this for just 13 bucks?!

Mom was very happy.
So I was very happy.

Great spot for quick, casual, quality Italian.  
Great service.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Yummy! Awesome service with delicious food. I really like their pesto pizza and lasagna. The kids menu is $7 comes with lemonade, pasta/pizza and dessert. The only down side is their chicken marsala is pretty salty. The flavor is their just better with less salt. Anyway, our experience has been great. Oh yeah, our waiter is really cool and nice to constantly check on us and replace Max's lemonade since kids will be kids and accidents happen. I will definitely come back and try their other dishes.
author: Christy V.

description:
I most say, am very impress with the services,
Food was great and reasonable price. Services was amazing very warm people. They made sure that I am doing okay . As I am eating lunch on my own. Made sure I got what I needed.  Good place to grab quick lunch. I will for sure  come back.
author: Lizzie E.

description: Came in for lunch in the middle of the day on a weekday with a friend. This place has the same feel as many of the other places in Laurel Village. The food is ok. Menu has good mix of heavier and lighter fare. They have lunch specials. Maybe it's because I'm not a giant pasta fan. Service is ok. I'd come back if I have a hankering for pasta.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Vixi is a cozy Italian restaurant in the Laurel Heights neighborhood of SF. I was recently on a trip here and found this place by searching for Italian restaurants in the city that were cheap and well-reviewed.

It's cozy, accommodating, and friendly. Along the main hallway of the restaurant is a row of two-seater tables that opens up to a larger space in the back. It's definitely a place where someone can come grab a nice meal by themselves. 

Service is excellent, though it seemed a little bit understaffed on the day I was there. I did, however, notice, that the waitress knew several of the other customer's names, which goes to show how established the restaurant is.

I ordered a Salmone pasta with Mista Salad off the lunch menu. Though the Mista salad was just a standard salad, the pasta was excellent, well-seasoned, and mixed with just the right amount of broccolini to round out the dish. Pretty satisfying with only a $13 price tag.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Nice family Italian good for lunch place. Service was friendly and food fresh and varied. Enjoyed cioppino, ravioli in pomodoro.
author: Jay B.

description: Finally dropped by Vixi and so glad we did! Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and we didn't have to wait to get seated on a Saturday night. I got the Fettuccini Funghi and it was pretty good- though the chicken was a bit dry. My husband got the Penne Gamberi and that was also delicious. The focaccia bread and tomato and olive oil dip was a nice complement to our meal. We also had the Cavolini side, which was good but I wish they were more crispy. All in all, a good meal!
author: Grace L.

description:
This italian restaurant has delicious bites! I ordered food from here on a whim without a clue of what to expect... and I was pleasantly surprised.  In fact,  I loved the food so much the first time,  I've gone back again and again. Some of my favorites are the Zuppa Di Tortellini soup and their Ravioli. 
Dine here,  you won't regret it.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Disappointing to say the least. I have been here once before when they first opened and it was relatively decent. I wanted to give it another try once they established themselves, and I'm sorry I did. I literally set a timer on my phone for 10 minutes, and my friend and I were never even offered water or greeted at the table. This was late afternoon with only 2 other parties seated in the restaurant; the staff was grouped together at the front counter on their cell phones. All I wanted was a glass of Pinot and some carbonara  Sad to say I will not be back. Ever.
author: Kathleen F.

description:
Vixi is a great find in Laurel Village, we had a great lunch  and felt very comfortable there. Just for lunch the 2 of us ordered bruschetta, cioppino, lasagna, pesto pizza, 2 desserts and drinks.

Delicious food is so addicting! lol But seriously Alex(host) and our waitress Candy(?) were great and made my dining experience @ Vixi #1.

Be back soon to chow out like crazy........
author: David W.

description:
Pros: very good fettucine funghi. Lovely balanced proportion of sauce, noodles and meat; great flavors; total comfort food. My friend said his salmon was perfectly cooked, flaky outside and just a bit rare in the middle.

Cons: Weird service. Everything just seemed off, like the restaurant hadn't figured out its operations yet. There was an unnecessary wait at the host's desk; our appetizers arrived well after our entrées; our server was friendly but flighty. The place was not very crowded, so... don't know what the situation was.

Oh, and at the end of the meal, the server put the check in front of my (male) friend and said, "Thank you, sir." Dude. Really? It's San Francisco and 2017 and... just no.

I might go back to see whether this was unusual night for them, but I'm not feeling particularly compelled. Despite the delicious fettucine. Maybe I'll just get the fettucine to go.
author: Neha B.

description:
Maybe a 2.5..or even a 3 IF service improves 

Greeter and good aroma upon arrival....4 

Waitress did not give a crap and did not listen to simple requests... 1
She was not engaged (at all).  Very much a one foot out the door attitude...a server should look you in the eye, be engaged a bit when talked to...but, nothing.
Two people get two piece of foccia and tiny bowl of olive oil/tomato dipping sauce?  Ask for more and get stink eye? Bad form and off putting to say the least. 

Noticed the yummy meatballs upon entering...worth ordering a few ala carte!  One would think bread would come along with the meatball, but no.  Nice appetizer though. 4 

Appetizers:  non ripe tomatoes in the caprese ... best not to serve I think ....$9
Salad:  got the mixed as no anchovy's in the ceaser salad?!  $5 for small. OK 

Had two kinds of pasta:  as described should have been two different sauces, looked and tasted the same.   Again, just mediocre.  $17 each.  Serving size acceptable...as taste was not engaging, did not eat it all....or take it home.  Shrimp dish did have 7-8 shrimp.

Plus was kids menu: drink, several choices (even a build your pasta!) And fruit or gelato dessert.   $7.  Nice if waitress would have brought drink or asked about dessert...never got drink and had to flag her down for dessert after she plunked down the bill.  Kids count on dessert.

Not too impressed.  I think if you live nearby, could be an affordable place for family night IF you get right items and good server.  We just didn't get either.
author: Nene R.

description:
Went here for a special occasion, friends were disappointed.

Salmon - nice + melt-in-mouth. House potatoes were nothing special

2 steaks - asked for Med Rare & Rare. Both steaks came out well done and tough to chew. Waitress was running around & we were hungry so just ate it. Whatever. 

Pasta - grilled chicken, sundried tomato, bacon, and heavy wine sauce. Wine sauce had a strong flavor, pretty good. 

The complimentary focaccia was tasty. Asked for seconds because the small salmon and overcooked steak wasn't doing it for us. 

Bad steak, decent pasta, & okay service. (Definitely gotta stick with pasta in an Italian cuisine.)
author: Gloria L.

description: Crummy dinner experience. The grilled chicken was way overcooked texture like leather. The server (Loretta) was distracted and inattentive. I heard the cooks ring the "meal's ready" bell three times before she responded...the chef even joking with her that "it's been 10 minutes." For the bambino I was eating with, his mixed fruit cup turned out to be just grapes...too lazy to chop other fruit? The room was smokey, with either the open kitchen poorly ventilated, or they were overcooking more than just my dinner. I recommend staying away.
author: RadioFreeMal C.

description:
3 stars. Ambiance us regular, nothing special. 
Our server forgot Caesar Salad and house bred. We had to ask for both while we got main dish. They promised us salad free to go, but we still had it in our bill. 
Not being said the table right next to us who got there 10 min after us got foot (and salad) quicker. 
Our bill with 2 entries and bottle of wine and small desert was $100. 
So I would search look for better options.
author: Katerina S.

description: Wonderful little place on California and Spruce. Service was amazing, prompt and friendly. The food was well put together.  I had the Pasta Bolognese and the sauce was perfect. It needed no additional seasoning.
author: Kristie D.

description:
Pretty good Italian food for a reasonable price. I came for lunch on a Friday because I was drawn in by their lunch menu. $13 gets you one entree (pasta or panini)  with a side of your choice: minestrone soup, caesar salad, or mista salad. I opted for the Salmon pasta (forgot the actual name) and the mista salad. They also serve you bread, which is probably one the best I've had in the US, accompanied with a delicious sun-dried tomato sauce which I thought was a nice change from the typical olive oil and vinegar.

The salad was good and well sized. To be honest, I was pretty satisfied after the bread and salad... could've taken that pasta to-go if I really wanted (warning: I have a really small stomach, this salad+ bread alone will not fill the average person up). The pasta itself was a bit on the smaller side, but they did not skimp on the salmon which is a huge plus in my books. Also, I think it's awesome that they use whole wheat pasta! 

I will definitely be back, have my eye on the Caprese panini next time!
author: Brenda L.

description: I love pasta with alfredo and I hadn't found a place in the Bay that has good Alfredo. I loved the fettuccine alfredo here!! It was creamy and delicious like homemade sauce.
author: Amy S.

description: The food was really good and it was awesome  how they have no qualms about your big stroller rolling in. Another couple showed up with twins in a stroller, and it was no big deal. The staff made room for everyone and it wasn't tight in the back dining area. They have six high chairs available so I think it's a kid friendly place. We sat down and someone eventually took our order because she said our server was busy. We weren't offered the specials and had to ask about them. She was friendly and described the dishes and made everything sound good. She took our order and said we'd get bread. She brought our drinks and no bread. Then the actual server came by and again said she'd bring bread. No bread. At least not until after we ate up the Clams and Mussels and I decided to ask the busser for bread to soak up the remaining sauce. Our entrees took forever. One table next to us ordered when we ate our appetizer and left before we even ate half our entrees. And another table arrived after us, ate, and left before we did. My husband had the Chicken Sundried Tomato with Broccolini Pasta and I had the Chicken Cacciatore. Both were really good. I think they served up the best Minestrone I've had in a long time. The broth had good flavour and a nice amount of veggies but not too much. The bread was hot and tasty. The prices were great except for the $22 price tag for the Chicken Cacciatore. That seemed steep. But for $12, you can get a lunch pasta or panini with a side salad or soup. The service was really bad. It was friendly but not attentive nor consistent. Multiple tables had to ask for their check or a box and the place was NOT that busy. They had a lot of staff too, a host, a busser, and two servers for what looked like five or six tables of one to three people. Vixi is kid-friendly and parents approved! Good food, wine, and kids ok! May not be the best place if you're in a hurry. We didn't mind the wait because we were having a leisurely day and it met our requirements.
author: Jen L.

description: We love the food here 5 stars great service Alex  was our server he was great we also got a chance to meet the manager Carrisa she was wonderful we are definitely coming back!!
author: Oscar C.

description: Love this place! I always gave San Francisco crap for not having a half as decent Italian restaurant the two years since moving here...until now! Ordered the linguini with lobster/tomato sauce with mussels, clams, and calamari and man, it was worth it! Had a cute, yet laid back kind of ambiance too.  Would definitely be back here sooner than later!
author: Chris A.

description:
ordered the fettuccine funghi. unfortunately my plate was EXTREMELY salty and the chicken and sausages were burned so i pretty much just ate the noodles... very disappointed.

the guy at the front was also absolutely clueless. came in and told him i was here to pick up. he mumbles something and points to this other Asian employee who was working the front (not sure if it's because he didn't know what he was doing or because i am Asian myself and so he thought we could speak the same language???) i tell her i'm here to pick up and she points to the pick up orders right next to clueless dude who then finally gets with the program. he could have really just been on learning curve but if a customer comes in and clearly says in English, "i'm here to pick up my order," and there are two orders to go sitting right next to you, obviously the first thing you should do is ask me for my name... smh
author: Hello E.

description: Solid Italian. Ordered for delivery. Pretty pricey and wasn't as amazing as one might expect for $20 entrees but it came fast and hit the spot.
author: Daniel E.

description: I really wanted to like this place. I'm in the office working and I ordered through UberEATS. It came super fast but the chicken was burned leaving that horrible after taste in my mouth. Totally ruined the Marsala flavor. The Caesar salad was great!
author: Mary Ann J.

description: Vixi is a solid choice after running errands (and buying books!) at Laurel Village.  The food is great- especially the lasagna, which may be the best I've ever had.  I go there frequently with my kids (who love the cheesy pasta) and the staff is always lovely to us.
author: Linda S.

description:
We're still fans of Vixi for the same reasons I described earlier.  Just this past Monday we enjoyed another relaxing late lunch.  Service was typically friendly and efficient as always.

As for the food everything was as usual:  Fresh, plentiful, and tasty.  

Honestly I am not sure why some reviewers dislike Vixi.  Prices?  There are very few SF Bay Area restaurants nowadays that offer lunch specials for less than $20 including either soup or salad (and a cup is actually more like a bowl at other restaurants).  Even a la carte menu items are less than $20 . Also the portions to prices are more than fair.  Food quality?  Of course,Vixi isn't offering Michelin-starred gourmet meals; that isn't the theme.  It's simple food at simple prices.  So if one is expecting 5* courses then one will be highly disappointed, and surely if one dislikes pasta why bother to dine in an Italian restaurant??

Their wine list is also very fair; we always enjoy a lovely bottle of pinot grigio from CA for $24.  At other restaurants a half bottle costs more.
author: Luisa T.

description:
Excellent food, great service and friendly staff. We shared a large chopped salad. It was enough for 4 and was one the best I have had. Servings were generous with three out of four of us taking some home. 

Casual atmosphere and excellent food at reasonable prices.
author: Mike K.

description: I just got home from picking up my cioppino meal, bruschetta and verdure order.  My husband ate the cioppino and said that 1 out l of 4 clams were old and all the mussels were old.  The shrimp and fish were ok.  There was some sourness added to the sauce to probably mask the flavor.  He's a pescatarian and knows if something's not fresh.  The bruschetta topping was lackluster in flavor.  We will definitely not be repeat customers.
author: Susan L.

description:
I Feel vixi is better than pasta pomodoro. Their food has rich flavor and is very unique. So don't be mean to them if they say they're not pasta pomodoro. Try the food b4 you go crazy.

I'd eat that sun dried tomato stuff all day everyday.

They have this cool looking drink that i haven't tried yet. Believe it was lemonade with Like strawberry goodness.

The people I've encountered are super nice.

Good food great people. What more can you ask for?

I been looking for a cozy italian convenient spot in the city and i feel Vixi fulfills that.
author: Monica S.

description:
This is the perfect restaurant for where it is located and who is therefore likely to frequent it: local hospital and Laurel Village employees, and families. This is a group of customers who need fast, tasty, reasonably healthy and affordable food. 

My husband and I used to hold our noses and cover our eyes when we took our son to this old Pasta Pomodoro, which he loved. I nearly had a coronary when it suddenly shut down, because though it was never "good," it was a satisfying choice in other ways. When Vixi first opened, I was confused. Is this just Pasta Pomodoro with a new name? Are these the same owners? Different owners? But I have to say, since trying it, I have been consistently pleased by the efficiency and quality of the food. It definitely fills the void of "decent place I can take my kid that feels like an actual restaurant but doesn't come with the hassle of mega waits and slow service." 

Everyone who works there is always super friendly. They're probably not earning huge tips, yet they go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need at all times, and are very patient with little ones. 

I really hope this one lasts!
author: Kiesha R.

description:
Since I first came to this location when Pasta Pomodoro opened (maybe I'm dating myself), I was skeptical about this new restaurant which took over the space that had been occupied by Pasta Pomodoro for so long.

They have impressed me.

I want to send an extra special shoutout to Eric, the manager, as last week he took care of me after they made a mistake with my takeout order. Thank you so much Eric, people with your level of customer service are the ones that keep me coming back to businesses for more.

In terms of the food, I especially love the gamberi (appetizer as well as the pasta dish), the cavatappi and the funghi pastas. My friend and I also agreed that the sun-dried tomato sauce that came with the bread was fantastic. 

Vixi seems like a similar concept restaurant to pasta pomodoro, but with better quality ingredients as well as better service.
author: Erica L.

description:
My fiancé and I got takeout last night. I ordered the chicken parm --- it was great! Hence the two stars He got chicken marsala andddd

They messed up our order. When I called on the phone I asked if there was a mashed potatoes side for the chicken marsala. At first she said no, so we changed it to spaghetti and meatballs. Then she said, oh you can have mashed potatoes as a side. So we change back to marsala with side of mashed potatoes. 

I chose spaghetti for my chicken parm side because well duh, and I was surprised that I actually had to ORDER pasta for a pasta dish. (Is it wrong to think that chicken parm on noodles is standard??) 

So, we go to pick up our order and my fiancé asks for an order of garlic bread. The cashier says sure I'll just put some in the bag. Woohoo! Free garlic bread!!!

Then we get home. And lo and behold the marsala is accompanied by roasted potatoes. The bread is just table bread. The marsala is TINY and the chicken parm is a much bigger portion! 

I doubt that we will be back. Pointless if we can't get what we ordered!!!
author: Penny L.

description:
I could write a 5-star review on the smells alone.  We knew as soon as we walked through the door, that our meal would be outstanding.  

Clue number two that the food was going to be real and delicious: they served complimentary focaccia that both tasted good on its own and was a perfect vehicle for the most amazing tomato spread I've ever had.  The focaccia was buoyantly fresh (not oily) and the crust was crispy.  They must have used slightly dried tomatoes for the spread or I don't know how they got summer tomato taste on May 1. 

Slightly dried tomatoes were definitely in the fantastic pasta primavera sauce that my spouse got.  This pasta was whole wheat, mind you, which usually tastes awful to me but was actively good and loaded with fresh seasonal vegetables.  I got chicken Marsala which was absolutely perfect and chose farro as a side.  On a scale of 1-10, this farro was a 45 billion.  

I love that the food was not over-salted so we could taste ingredient purity and freshness.  All sauces were exquisitely flavorful and the sauce amount was perfect --- generous but not drowning.  This reminded me so much of delicious food we had in Italy.  

Thanks to the cooks.
author: Hadas R.

description: Finally, there is a nice and cozy pasta restaurant opened in town. It's just your mom's kitchen, casual and warmy. The food is-- delicious. The service is friendly and polite. I'll be missing this cozy pasta restaurant very much when I move out the city.
author: René A.

description: I started at Vixi Cucina Italiana, but wanted to scope out all my options. I made my way to Geary and walked up and down, but found myself back at Vixi! I am glad I did. The waitstaff was friendly and incredibly helpful in assisting me with the menu. My waitress even played along and surprised me with one of the three chocolate desserts offered, at my request. Please try! Quite delicious and a comfortable atmosphere.
author: Liv D.

description: Got the penne gamberi from uber eats. The food arrived quickly and they followed my instructions of giving bread and spaghetti instead of penne. The sauce was super tasty and the shrimp was cooked well. I'm italian and super picky on eating italian food out but this hit the spot!
author: Paul S.

description:
Not bad at all.  I like Le Parmigiana.  I'd repeat!!
I just happened to be passing through and stumbled upon this place via yelp.  I'd recommend this place.
author: Rick R.

description: Pretty small restaurant with a pretty good selection of pastas. The bread and dip was so good that my table kept asking for more. Great atmosphere and service. They accommodated my relatively large group after I called to make a reservation a few hours earlier.
author: Kristine C.

description:
New place that opened after Pasta Pomodoro closed up.
First dish I had was the Polpette which is their version of spaghetti and meatballs.  This dish was pretty tasty with a little spicy kick added to it which was not overbearing. In had this coupled with their Gamberi appetizer which in itself really stood out to me with flavor and well cooked shrimp.  I've since been back a few times and had dishes such as their tortellini, lasagna, and chicken marsala all of which were very delicious as well as filling.  It is a little pricey but you get what you pay for and I will be returning again!  :-)
author: Dominic Y.

description:
Really good value! I brought my stroller and an annoying baby and they were only nice! Glasses of wine come with cute mini carafe: good amount and good vino!

The menu reminds me of pasta pomodoro, but I prefer it now. I have to say the chicken I added to my pasta was dry, so maybe skip that... But the Caesar salad that came w my lunch meal: awesome. I liked the cheese! Flecked with pepper.also the bread and dip: amazing. Maybe it's out of season but I was looking for a pumpkin ravioli w sage. I hope their menu incorporates something like this soon!

Mum mum! I say softly while the baby sleeps.
author: Meghan O.

description: So dissapointed with this restaurant. Arrived for an early dinner around 4:30. We were promptly seated but had to wait a long while for our dishes. I ordered the chicken Marsala and my husband ordered the salmon. The complimentary bread and dipping was wonderful, but the meal went downhill from there. Canned Christmas music instead of Italian, Chicken was dry and the the Marsala sauce tasted like BBQ sauce. Brussels sprouts were burnt with no flavor. Service was adequate and the waiter did waive my dinner cost. But I doubt we'll be back.
author: Mira S.

description: This has to be the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco! Our server, Jennifer, was very attentive and helpful. Her recommendation of the chicken parmigiana and the spinach ravioli was the best food I've had and the owner Zeeshan was on site and an absolute delight to converse with! I will definitely be coming back again and again.
author: Burhan M.

description:
Another loving review for this Italian delight!! So i haven't actually been here but it is my
Go-To spot on Postmates and Uber Eats. The salmon and chicken parm are delicious. Healthy and sides are food. Also you would be remissed if you didn't get a kiddie size lasagne -
author: Tanya S.

description: Came here today for a late lunch with my boyfriend and had a great experience. Seated quickly, got our order in and our food came quick. The food was really good. Both mine and my boyfriends dishes were delicious, we ordered The cavatappi and the penne gamberi
author: Kaila B.

description: Came for a lunch with my daughter an they have affordable lunch special.  The minestrone soup and bread before meal were very good.  I had the chicken pesto panini and she had pesto pasta.  Both very good.  Would come again
author: Vinnie W.

description: Severs were super kind and professional. I would go this place because of them that served my people so kindly. Moreover, foods were so flawless, delicious. Seriously, if I go around there area again, I'll drop by this restaurant again.
author: Changmin L.

description:
Love this place. This is my go to for affordable Italian and I'm not just saying this because I live around the corner.  I use to drive here all the time when I resided in Chinatown. That's how much I appreciate their service.

Best thing on the menu is fettucine funghi and the pasta dish with creamy tomato sauce. I forget the name but I've just about tried everything on the menu
author: Win C.

description:
I visited this place with my mom, grandma, wife and two young boys.  The food was delicious.  I tried the Minestrone soup, lasagna, a salad with warm vegies, the kids pizza, a pasta with seafood and a coke to wash it down.  I didn't eat this all by myself.  We shared.

The food was delicious.  All of it.  Super good and the restaurant itself is well decorated and inviting.  The only reason why I can't give 5 stars is because the waiter was just so so.  He wasn't rude but he wasn't cheerful either.  He just seemed to be not in the mood to be there.  We all have those days though so I don't want it to discourage anyone.
author: Oliver T.

description: Literally the best food I've had since moving to San Francisco you are missing out if you haven't stopped by
author: Caitlin H.

description: Vixi's food is amazing!  I recommend the Cavatapi it is delicious.  The service was amazing as well.  Jennifer M was our server and let me tell you...she rocked.  I didn't have to ask for one refill.  I will definitely be back.
author: Rona D.

description: The lasagna was delicious, although I prefer a cheese lasagne and this was all meat. Unfortunately it may have been microwaved in the crock because it came out screaming hot, but was room temp inside. Good minestrone soup but I didn't care for the highly rated tortellini kale soup. Good value. Big portions. Super nice people and service. Atmosphere has a lot to be desired, but willing to try again there and on Caviar.
author: Nancy R.

description: I happen to be looking for a great Italian place in San Francisco and we found this amazingly delicious place called Vixi Cucina Italian restaurant OMG this place is so so good I would definitely recommend that you try it absolutely should try it 10 thumbs upand the staff professional and friendly
author: Mary D.

description: Must try!! Ordered on caviar for delivery. Food was actually very hot, fresh & great!! Often pasta doesn't travel well but in this case it was perfect. Pasta with mushrooms & chicken was our favorite. Looking forward to dining in soon : )
author: Sapna P.

description:
Delicious delicious delicious! Very attentive staff as well, will come again! 

Enjoyed the clams with tomato sauce, brussel sprouts and lasagna.
author: Melissa L.

description: This was a Yelp suggested restaurant that lived up to its comments. The pasta is very fresh and delicious, my favorite dish being the tortellini alla panna. So much flavor! It was very simple but the combination worked really well. The service was also great and timely without a lot of follow ups in the middle of chewing your dinner. I would highly recommend it and will be back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: M B.

description: Vixi is new to the Laurel Heights area on California St. To sum it up, it's just plain 'ol good pasta. You can't really go wrong here. I'll also say it's better than the other restaurants on this block imo. On one occasion, we ordered in and got the tortellini soup (great!) and a Caesar salad (just normal, what you'd expect from a Caesar). Last night we decided to dine in. We ordered the mushroom fettucini and lasagna, both which were solidly good and fairly priced. I will say that the ambiance was not as fancy or even homey as I was expecting, but it was still clean and fine. They do get extra points for fantastic service. Always attentive, very accommodating (didn't rush us even though we were the last people to show up - 20 min before closing), offered us extra bread and delicious dipping sauce and more. I thought we were well taken care of. I'd go back!
author: Ann L.

description: Absolutely amazing!!!! Loved everything I ordered, the staff is polite, the food was hot and fresh, my order was correct, and it was super fast! Great atmosphere, definitely a hangout spot!
author: Melanie J.

description:
First, Thank you Zeeshan for opening this great place. Everything was delicious. 

Went to this place with a friend who's familiar in the area and the food was fresh, tasty, and priced very well. The Mista Salad, with gorgonzola and balsamic vinegar was something that was of new taste, since I don't like gorgonzola personally. But, having the balsamic vinegar taste, the salad was delicious and not over done with the cheese. My friend liked her beef soup and we do want to return and try the other dishes that kept passing around us to the other patrons. 

The service was great, because everyone was kind from the moment you step in and out, and our server was very attentive to make sure we were either wanting for drinks or just had any questions about the menu. And the coffee? Love the little jars it comes in and the taste? Strong but delicious. 

Definitely recommend it.
author: Audis V.

description: We were hesitant of this place at first seemed a little franchisey. It's fantastic! We love it and get take out at least once every other week. Their food is really good! But their prices are reasonable!! Makes it perfect for takeout. No one likes to pay that SF fancy gourmet overpriced for take out so for this neighborhood it's great. Tons of families that would usually want to eat out but need to get kids in bed can just order takeout and get delicious food nearby. Love it!! Some favorites include their pizzas perfect size for two people to split w ordering another entree or salad/app. I like how size isn't huge and price is appropriate so you can still order 1-2 more things to have variety! My husband loves pizza wher I would prefer pasta and salad so we just order all 3 and have a great dinner. Please don't go! Happy pomodoro is gone and Vixi is here!
author: Katie D.

description: This is not a 5 start restaurant, but it is a 5 star at what it is trying to be. Very substantive food with good beer selection. Good wine as well. Came here for my wife's birthday. Great selection. Will definitely come again. My go-to Italian place in the city.
author: Matthew F.

description: This amazing restaurant is so close to home that I have to admit I almost overlooked it with the expansive selection we have in SF.  Seriously, this is some of the best Italian food I've eaten outside of Florence, Italy.  The polo griglia and chicken marsala are mouth wateringly delicious, tender and perfectly seasoned.  The pizzas are perfect and rival any fancy artisan pizza place in the city.  Get the tortillini soup if you want a hearty, soul warming experience on a foggy day.  Vixi is going to exceed your expectations.
author: Julia S.

description:
Food was great,billing was fraudulent. For a $47 check, me and my friend were charged $47 and. $ 24.95 respectively. This is when I signed the record for $26 and my friend did for $25. Also, the place was not crowded when we visited so no excuses and f a busy day. I checked my statement after 10 days to check the amount and then called.The
Lady first refused to acknowledge and then said that my friend is not charged anything. I requested my friend to share his card number and only then the lady accepted. Then she said," come to the restaurant with cards and receipt". I was like
Wow. Then she asked me to mail both card numbers to get it corrected. I couldn't understand why my friend need to share his card number on email when he bas been charged more than 50 percent already. I gave up and would not send my card number on email. Not worth $20. THEREFORE CHECK YOUR CARD STATEMENTS, restaurant does wrong charging. If they wanted, they could have refunded me.
author: Amit K.

description: New Italian spot? Yes! There's unique dishes here. Great complimentary bread and dipping sauce. Ordered the penne gemberi, the cavatappi, fungi pasta. The best gemberi was the best. The other two were a bit too salty. Overall I docked a star because the proportions in the dish weren't that great - it was kinda small and you didn't get that much pasta, but the meat portion was decent.
author: Monica E.

description: The staff here works well together. I felt happy and welcome from the moment I walked in, without being overwhelmed! The lunch menu is what brings me in, good portion sizes, and very tasty.
author: Angela F.

description: I first ate here last year when we were at CPMC after delivering my baby (wahoo and holy hungry). It's become one of my favorite spots!!
author: Michelle Q.

description: This restaurant is amazing! Our server was a delight to have and I would definitely go back and request Pedro! He really makes the environment that much better! The food was excellent, service superb, and vibe enjoyable! 5 stars hands down
author: Nicole G.

description: This is a great restaurant for family-friendly Italian food. The food was delicious. They have a great kids menu, a good amount of entrees and pasta dishes. I ordered the Cavatappi and my sister and niece wouldn't stop picking at my dish.
author: Stanley T.

description: Very yummy. I had the linguini funghi (yum!!) and my fiancée enjoyed his spaghetti and meatballs.
author: Sara H.

description:
I came here for early lunch today with my family.  Everything was top notch, from the waitstaff to the front of the house, the ambience, and especially the food.
The warm complimentary bread was great with the house dip.
We shared the Carni pizza appetizer. The various toppings were great it was very cheesy and just had enough of that crunch to make it exceptionally tasting.
The minestrone soup was one of the best that I have had. In fact I ordered a portion to take home to enjoy it later.
The spaghetti and meatball were nicely prepared.
I finish with a tiramisu. very very yummy.
author: George Q.

description:
This was really disappointing.  I was excited to try it and wanted to like it, since all the other reviews were great and I'd love to have neighborhood Italian spot.  So sad to say this but it was not good and I will never go back.  

The service was okay but pushy - they are really pushing bottles of wine over glasses.  I can totally forgive that though it the food was good.  It was not.

My husband had the chicken parmesan and it was flavorless and dry.  I had the frutti di mare and it was unusually fishy tasting with no other flavors - I actually think the fish was bad.  My son had the lasagna and even that wasn't very good.  

The wines were good, even though we had them by the glass against our waiter's very strong recommendation.

Wanted to share my experience - hopefully it was an anomaly but it was so bad I had to post something.  Such a bummer
author: Jill G.

description: Food was so scrumptious, just loved it! Server was inattentive and even left twice before we could complete our order with wine and appetizers. Food came quickly though. Automatically included a 20% tip for herself in the bill and it couldn't be altered. Also she said her computer system could not make separate tickets for diners at the same table. We offered to split up into different tables, but she said it just couldn't happen, period. So, we couldn't use receipts for business reimbursement. If we'd had a better experience with server, this could've easily been a five star review based on the awesome food! Sad for owner and chefs that she's representing them so poorly and that I don't feel like returning because of her.
author: Kelli B.

description: Absolutely love the penne gamberi so yummy! Will get as much as I can. there bread with tomato n olive oil just is the cherry on top delicious.
author: Makaila L.

description: Wonderful neighborhood restaurant. Great food, nice causal atmosphere and friendly staff.  The prices are extremely reasonable for San Francisco. Highly recommend!
author: Ellie L.

description:
The food is good but the service is often overly rushed.  Dinner this evening took 30 minutes -- from the time seated to exiting the door.  The attitude projected was "hurry up and eat your delicious food and get your 
a$$ out of here." I don't understand the rush because there were only four other occupied tables.  

I've been here almost weekly since their opening.  The food is good.  I've tried several dishes and all were delicious.  My particular favorites are  Frutti di Mare and Ravoli with Pomodoro sauce.  The wine selection is small but good, with reasonable by the glass prices.  Try the Orvieto Classico -- very nice.

The woman at the next table this evening ordered the Cioppino.  It looked delicious and she said it was good.  I may consider returning to see for myself.  I'll think about it.  I dine out with friends to enjoy a good meal and conversation which isn't possible in 30 minutes.

4 stars for the food and an average 2 stars for service.
author: Donna P.

description:
This neighborhood is full of restaurants that overcharge for super mediocre food.

The food at Vixi, on the other hand, is quite good (their chicken parm is classic comfort food) and their prices are totally reasonable. It's sad that getting good food at a fair price has become a rarity, but that makes us appreciate Vixi all the more.

We live across the street, and for food we usually head to Clement or Fillmore; Vixi is the only nearby restaurant we actually enjoy going to. Quality food at a fair price: highly recommended.
author: Kent H.

description:
Went there today for lunch with work colleagues and couldn't be happier with service and food.  When you walk in you are greeted by trays of freshly made pasta, and an authentic-looking open kitchen dominated by large pizza ovens.  Various aromatic scents invite you - garlic, fresh basil, mushrooms, tomato sauce among others.  Everything served here is fresh; no cans no jars!  I tried a dish I had never heard of before, the cavatappi, a wonderful fresh twirly pasta preparation with crimini mushrooms, plump, juicy morsels freshly-grilled chicken, bacon, sundried tomatoes, and a delicious mushroom sauce.  Decadent, and a far cry from the mediocre and unappetizing lineup served by Vixxi's predecessor, Pasta Pomedoro.

I'll be back, Vixi, next time I crave lovingly-prepared cucina Italiana!
author: Evleen A.

description:
I was in the Laurel Heights neighborhood doing some errands and I decided to step into Pasta Pomodoro for a quick dinner. As I walked in I noticed the restaurant had changed hands and it's now called VIXI, which translates to "I have lived."

I chose to sit at the bar because i like to see how the restaurant is run. The staff treat each other like family. That's because they basically are. They're all Pasta Pomodoro alumni and they will all rattle off when they joined the company, every location they worked at, and their favorite dishes over the years. 

It turns out PP has left the City. The owner of VIXI was a long-time PP staffer who wanted to keep what they'd had going here so he asked if he could open VIXI where the last PP was closing. 

The decor has been updated. They still need to fine tune the lighting but it has an easy, pleasant atmosphere.  PP had started to feel kind of assembly - line and it felt like there was no reason to linger over the meal. The check was always rushed even when our table was still chatting.

My meal was delicious. The wine list was great. But what I loved most was the neighborhood feel.  Eric the manager made a point to ask me my name and to introduce me to all the staff behind the bar. At one point Eric excused himself from our chat to go speak with a new hire. They actually hugged at the host stand like old comrades. He must be part of the old SF PP family as well. 

This world is so pressed for time,  everything feels so rushed, so impermanent. Come in to VIXI to take a break from all that and relax with family and friends. I want to see this place thrive.
author: Liz T.

description: This place was incredible! First off, the service was absolutely amazing. Our server and the manager were super friendly, funny, and very hospitable. Second, the FOOD!!!!!! It's like having Michelin star rated quality food, with a casual atmosphere, and VERY fair prices. I went with two other friends and we got the bruschetta to start, a bottle of wine, and then the fettuccine fungi, Polpette, and penne gamberi.  We each tried each other's dishes and each one was delicious. Great spot for dinner with friends or a casual date. Lastly, we had the raspberry chocolate mousse for dessert.... We might as well have licked the plate clean!
author: Jessica A.

description: Best Italien restaurant in San Francisco! I lived in Europe for 11 years and San Francisco for 27. The cavitapi is artfully superb as is their pizza. Parking is also super easy and prices are very reasonable.
author: Edward M.

description: Everything was perfect for such a small place from the sitting to the exiting the restaurant was superb!!
author: Julieta C.

description: Friendly and accommodating service by our Costa rican waiter. Good food.
author: Ked B.

description: I love this little Italian place and the food is way better than the chain that used to be there before. After coming back from Italy this summer I was craving a good Italian meal that tasted authentic. This hit the spot. You can tell the owner cares a lot about this place and I often see him there. The staff is really sweet and hard working to serve you a quality meal at a decent price.
author: Brooke R.

description:
I had the best rib eye steak ever, with wonderfully seasoned tiny potatoes, and a very good side of kale.  While waiting, I had a great and again the best lemonade ever.  Very, very Good food and service.  Much better than the menu at the previous restaurant, although it was good.

I design restaurants as an architect and have eaten in many fine ones here, in Atlanta and many  other places including Europe, but never had food as good.  Congratulations, guys!!! :-) :-) :-)

Thanks for the great cooking, flavors, and having food I can eat, I have allergies to gluten, chicken, egg, sodium in different forms, preservatives and many chemicals, so your menu has already become a favorite, thanks for cooking gluten free pasta as well!!!
author: Janet C.

description: New place after Pasta Pomodoro, the selection of food seems the same except for a few changes in the menu, service was amazing and our server Mike was incredibly friendly. The kids menu is pricey for what they serve and I wish they had a healthier choice for children. The environment seems the same as Pasta Pomodoro so I would say I haven't seen any changes in the place.
author: Suzy R.

description: Great prices and delicious food. My favorite all-around Italian restaurant in the city!
author: Fred F.

description: Went here for the first time a few weeks ago. I was in the area and was intrigued. The waitress was very nice and I liked the ambiance. Since this was my first time here I asked the waitress what she would recommend. She suggested the cavatappi: it had chunks of applewood smoked bacon, grilled chicken, sundried tomatoes, and mushrooms highlighted by a smoky mushroom sauce. The complimentary focaccia bread was delicious, as was the sundried tomato olive oil paste they had with it. Overall the food was delicious and I had a great time here. I will definitely be back.
author: Beth G.

description: Really cute new spot with lovely waitstaff. They were so nice and I would absolutely give them a 5 based on the service but the food wasn't as good as I was expecting. I got the tortellini with pancetta and sage in cream sauce and it was ok but SO oily. I actually couldn't finish it and took it home to eat the next day and it gave me an upset stomach. My bf got the lamb stew and polenta and it was also ok but could have been hotter and there could have been more lamb. They also don't have a liquor license yet which is also a minus. Overall, great service, average food.
author: Jenn A.

description:
Love this neighborhood Italian restaurant!! I can do groceries at Laurel Village, and pop over for a quick lunch. 
Very friendly host and servers. 
Upon being seated, we are served warm focaccia bread with a sundries tomato relish. Delicious!! 
My favorite is the pasta with tomato cream sauce and shrimp. My son always has the Alfredo, with chicken and broccoli added. Sooooo good!! 
Could be very busy with the hospital and offices nearby. 
Parking is tricky, but it can be found. The best part is delivery from Postmates.
author: lovetoeat a.

description: The food was very good. Great atmoshere and lovely waitress.
author: Ilana G.

description: This small neighborhood Italian restaurant is now one of my favorite spots to eat for date night with my husband. They have gluten-free pasta, the portions are large, the food excellent, and the service quite good. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Jo G.

description: What a gem, offering fine fare skillfully served, friendly front of the house, nice wine selection, and informal atmosphere. Will return whenever i am in that part of town. Three of us had different pasta dishes and salads, everyone was happy. It took will power but we resisted asking for more bread.
author: Laura F.

description: We have only purchased take out, but everything we have ordered has been delicious.  We loved the chopped salad, the cavatappi, pizza and lasagna.  The lasagna is not made with ricotta cheese, the absence of which our family much prefers.  We are excited to go down to the actual restaurant soon.  Thanks.
author: TK B.

description:
Pasta pomodoro was one of our regular eating places whenever we were in the mood for pasta, or soup and salad.  I give it 5 stars for being an acceptable pasta place in SF with plenty of parking nearby.   I repeat - acceptable pasta in San Francisco with parking!!  
Needless to say I went into panic mode when I found out they closed down, but relieved to see that Vixi appears to be the same restaurant with some changes.  The biggest change for us was that the free bread at the beginning did not include the olive oil pesto which we kind of liked.  Bread was also a bit different.  Otherwise the dishes we generally order are pretty similar.  The last thing for me to confirm is if the slip&slide floor has been fixed.
author: J M.

description: I went there with a friend and it was a really good place their appetizers was awesome I got a shrimp with tomato sauce I felt my self in Italy back on time :) after the entre was a Fruti di Maree wow it was the really tasty , the stuff there were very friendly and nice they check on you every 5 mins for refills really liked the place thanks guys .
author: Rahim B.

description: Wonderful dinner. Perfect sauces, wonderful flavor. They don't have their liquor license yet, but they encourage you to bring something from the nearby liquor store in the meantime. Casual but smart atmosphere, and fast service.
author: Nathan L.

description: Pleasantly surprised by this random find. The place is clean and comfortable, but not fancy.  The atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was friendly and fast (we had a really nice Italian server.) My friend and I both loved our pastas: they were tasty and authentic. Their focaccia wasn't great, but the tomato dipping sauce was very good.  Will definitely go again next time I am craving Italian.
author: JJ M.

description: The food is delicious!! I ordered the Gamberi and the Caesar salad with chicken. The restaurant is family friendly. Even my kids (who are picky eaters) enjoyed the food! We had a great time. The employees and manager are nice and welcoming. I love the ambiance, it's cool and relaxed. Me and the kiddos will definitely be going back!
author: E O.

description: Went in for a late dinner last night with family and had a lovely time. Server and staff were helpful, gracious. The food was well thought out. Great apps, lovely proseco offerings. I can't wait to go back.
author: Kitty W.

description: I'd give this place 500 stars if Yelp allowed me. Fantastic food, reasonable prices. We're from out of town but the next time we're back in San Francisco we're coming back for sure!
author: Ed A.

description: Great food, great service! The food was brought ought with fashionable timing. The waitresses were very happy to meet all our wishes without any questions asked. I would definitely recommend Vixi Cucina Italiana to any Italian food lover.
author: Austin F.

description: My husband and I came here twice.  Food is delicious and portions are big when comparing other restaurants charging $17-18 for an entree.  Free breads and dip for two rounds, service was great. We will definitely come back again.
author: Mei Y.

description: Wow! What a great find, this restaurant is the casually perfect ambiance for a nice dinner with close friends or nice date. The food is top notch and staff is attentive. The best...
author: Ali M.

description: Terrific little place for a wonderful Italian meal without breaking the bank. We stopped in between checkout and our red eye back to Philadelphia, after my international restaurant guide Yelp'd it and remembered that we had walked past it on the way to the closing weekend of Summer Love earlier in the day. What a find. The people were really lovely, and the selection of dishes was more than adequate to suit anyone's taste. I've had a lot of great Italian food in my lifetime, and this was right up there with the best of it. My only regret is that I live on the right coast and don't get to the left very often.
author: Paul H.

description: Food was okay. Nothing to write home about. Whoever mentioned Michelin-star quality either had a verrrrrry different experience or is friends/family of owner. Food was too salty. Broccolini was over cooked and soggy. Seafood in Frutti di Mare was noticeably not fresh enough, though still edible. Had high hopes for a cheap, fast Italian place in the neighborhood, but was fairly disappointed.
author: Scott H.

description: Great price for good food. Excellent family option with no wait and a traditional menu. We will definitely be back and put this place into our family line up!
author: Margot L.

description:
WOW!!! THIS PLACE IS THE BEST!

This is my first review so I hope this helps anyone searching for a top quality Italian spot in SF.

I discovered Vixi Cucina Italiana when my wife was recovering from labor at the hospital across the street. I was in need of a healthy but filling salad so my first order was the Italian Chopped. It was so delicious I ordered it three days in a row. 
Usually, I think subpar restaurants surround hospitals because the demand is alway there and the quality doesn't have to be high. THANK GOD Vixi Cucina Italiana is the exception. My first visit was three months ago and since then I've almost tried the entire menu. I've NEVER been disappointed. So delicious. So much flavor. You can taste almost every ingredient in each recipe.
The service is also top tier. I've placed pick up orders, ate at the restaurant, and recently I've been having food delivered through UBER Eats. Obviously, eating at the restaurant is preferred, but the food always tastes the same which is what I believe defines a top quality restaurant. Lastly, Eric (Manager) is such a kind, wonderful, friendly person. 

I can go on an on about this place! 

Usually, I try to avoid Italian because every restaurant tastes the same but thank God I found one that stands out. I live on the other side of the city and will gladly make the 20min drive to dine there. 
If you call bullshit, well try it out for yourself. I'm very confident you will share the same excitement. 

Cheers!

Some of my favorites: Gamberi, Capellini with Pesto, Italian Chopped, Fresh Squeezed Lemonade, Cavatappi
author: Colin M.

description: The food and service are both good. It's a casual dining spot at Laurel Village. Parking is quite easy on the streets or at the parking lot behind the shops. I love the bread and the dipping sauce. I had the fettuccine funghi, my friend had the cioppino, and we also shared a side order of roasted Brussel sprouts. Delicious! I will be back.
author: M L.

description: The food has improved since it opened. But seriously... DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE FLIES. They're all over the place and have been since this place was Pasta Pomodoro. It ruins the dining experience. one or two I can overlook. But they're circulating right near the front door when you walk in and all over the long side wall of the dining room. I'd hate to think about the kitchen. GROSS.
author: Mark L.

description: Great service from Jhon! Great food for the price! Excellent recommendations from Jhon. The frutti di mare was good-
author: Anthony A.

description: I was in the area and needed food on this past 4th of July holiday. It was the only restaurant open and we are so thankful it was! We were immediately seated upon arrival. The waiter helped us pick out some delicious wine and gave us some yummy focaccia bread to start with.  I ordered the special, butternut squash ravioli with brown sugar sauce, and my mom ordered the cavatappi, they were both delicious! I would definitely recommend checking this place out! We will be back!
author: Oriana S.

description: Love Vixi! This place is delicious & fresh food in a casual setting. John was our server. He was very attentive & provided to the ambiance. I was very impressed with the quality of the food at such a reasonable price. We will definitely be back. Such a great neighborhood find.
author: Margaret S.

description: Enjoyed trying a new Italian place while on vacation from Florida. SF is a foodie town to be sure, so we felt confident with trying this place. Service was friendly, and everyone at the table enjoyed what they ordered. Only exception: my 8 year old niece didn't enjoy her lasagna (it wasn't the standard recipe, it had spinach and mushrooms, things a kid might not like). The ravioli was awesome (some of the best we had), and the sauce was on point!
