The tortellini soup was perfect (my husband doesn't typically go for tortellini, but he took a chance and was blown away!), and the salad was great too! We all had a great experience!
author: Maryanne L.

description:
This seals my fate with Vixi now.  Thrice I've visited and all three times, the food was way too salty. I never like to make anyone uncomfortable but I finally couldn't handle it and told the server at the end of my meal (very apologetically) that it was just simple too salty! He told me to order it "no salt" next time b/c it could be the pasta cooked in salt water and then the salt garnishing and additional salt for taste at the end.  That's pretty insane.  I didn't eat much of my lunch order and packed it home to doctor it up just to make it edible.  I've been here many times with coworkers (even when it was Pasta Pomodoro) and it's been hit or miss but the last several times have made me feel less incentivized to keep coming back.  The strip on California Street really does get boring (food and probably otherwise) for locals; not a lot of selection to choose from so it's bound to happen that I'll have no choice but to be back...but probably not for a long while though, as long as I can hold off until my rotation of eateries run old. 
In any case, the service is nice despite the heavy handed salt on food.  The lunch special is great and their sundried tomatoes dip for the bread is a nice touch.
author: Tu L.

description: Super accommodating for us and the kiddo.   It wasn't too crowded and the portions were very generous.   Nice, quick and delicious Friday night dinner.  Thanks so much!
author: Edgar C.

description: Have been here a few times and each time the staff was super friendly and the food was 5 star quality in my book. Only thing I was disappointed in is they don't give you free bread and olive oil or other dipping sauce like many other Italian restaurants do (including the one at this location before) and sometimes we leave a little hungry after our meal.
author: Kristianne M.

description: We practically live in the hospital next door. So I've been eating here a lot. To the owner, who I think I saw pacing the floor last night when I picked up my pizza (my $10 amazing delicious gourmet pizza which has to be a loss leader), I think you need to do more incentivization of the hospital staff. Give them some amazing discount for 6 months then drop it to something more modest, then something sustainable after about a year. Just realize that the Starbucks next door is open 24 hours because that one resource drives enough traffic to sustain them. It's not the staff that is going to make you so full that people are waiting in line outside (showing the world how great your restaurant is), it's all of us, the patient's families, they will recommend you to who will make the difference. This place needs to be packed out the door. Once you can't hold another human being inside of the building, then you can worry about pricing up to curb the demand and enjoy the spoils. And you can expand. Look at Super Duper Burger. Keep it consistent and keep it awesome. You're off to a great start.
author: Marc R.

description:
Dropped into Vixi last night.  Not my usual type of spot and realized I'd never eaten in that location before.  Why?  Oh, yes, because it used to be a Pasta Pomodoro.  I rarely eat Italian (although, I like it) and tend to stay away from chains (except for Taco Bell).  So, enough about me, more about Vixi.  
The good:  let me just say that the food was good, and the service was wonderful.  
The bad:  not really bad, but odd and easily correctable.  Stupid stuff really, but stuff I noticed.  Don't know when they opened but they seemed to be over staffed on what was possibly an unexpectedly slow night, or maybe it was a training night?  I hope this was an anomaly and not their normal staffing practice.  You might think, what's wrong with too many people?  $$.  I always want business to survive (especially ones with yummy food) and would hate to see them fail early because they don't have staffing tuned in to the needs of a given night.  
Second stupid thing to fix:  I'm not sure if they have figured out their identity yet.  The staff have these cheesy t-shirts that don't work with the vibe of the interior and the quality of the food.  And lastly, the other really nit-picky thing...the music.  Don't get me wrong, I liked everything that was playing and have it all, but it just didn't fit the vibe.  I'd go more with cool world beat.  Putamayo has an excellent CD called 'Italian Cafe', start there.  Think Dean Martin, Pink Martini and Paolo Nutini.  
Why, you ask, should any of this matter?  Because their food is nuanced in a lovely way and when the space and atmosphere is discordant, it feels off.

So let's talk more about their food.  Focaccia with olive oil and sun dried tomato paste to start. I had a lovely pasta dish with mushrooms, grilled chicken, sausage and arugula in a cream sauce.  It had a meaty flavor due to the mushrooms but not overwhelmingly so and a subtle sweetness that balanced it out.  Thank you fennel and cream for that.  My husband had the spaghetti with meatballs and he enjoyed it.  The other thing we ordered to share was the faro side.  It needed a little more seasoning.  Either some plain ol' salt n peppah or a shot of an herb to brighten it up.  Lemon zest?  Fresh parsley?  Call me crazy, but an spash of ouzo?  Still, I loved the simple combo of farro, tomatoes and kale.  Good start.  

Dear Vixi, keep it going kids.  You've got a great location, beautiful space, fine food and quality people.  I wish you well.
author: Kim S.

description: Amazing, authentic Italian food. Great prices and portions. We're now regulars. I highly recommend it!
author: Dan R.

description: Usually don't write reviews but this place deserves one! I just ordered the margherita pizza and bruschetta on Uber Eats and what a surprise to have a delicious meal delivered in no time at all! My pizza was hot and bruschetta chilled. I was also excited to find a piece of focaccia and sun dried tomato dip included. I look forward to eating at the actual restaurant. Thanks for the great delivery package!
author: Emily B.

description: Everything was great. From wood oven pizza appetizers, soups, salads, pastas and seafood dishes we were pleased with everything. Ambiance is a little plain. Don't let that turn you away. Food and wait staff (John was the bomb) were excellent. When I'm back in San Francisco I'll come back!  They've only been here 4 months and I can only imagine it will keep getting better!
author: Mike S.

description: Food was ok but service was really poor. Don't go here unless you have a lot if time. We were here on Wednesday evening, maybe 12 people in the place still took forever to get the food
author: Garry P.

description: We had my 12-year-old daughter's birthday party dinner at Vixi Cucina and the service and food were great! They were very accommodating of the big group (and the volume!) and made it a great celebration :) We will definitely be back!!
author: Amy S.

description: There is a new owner, chef and staff at what used to be Pasta Pomodoro in Laurel Village - and I'm a fan. The menu is not much different but the prices seem a bit cheaper which is great. Most importantly - the food is very good. I had the meatballs and spaghetti dish and it was perfect. The service was excellent and I will definitely return.
author: J D.

description: I was craving Alfredo so my son and I popped in for lunch. Ordered the Alfredo and a bottle of wine. PERFECT! Great staff, very accommodating and friendly. Thank you!
author: Puna S.

description: Stumbled in for some Italian food after some urban hiking. The service was amazing by John and the atmosphere felt like I was apart of the family. Highly recommend this place! Ask for bread!
author: Blake F.

description: Pasta perfection. Came from a hike, very casual is accepted here. Ordered the pesto chicken pizza which was to die for. Then ordered pasta bolognese, my boyfriend got fettuccini fungi both would recommend!
author: Berry G.

description: Amazing! I am still stuffed from the fabulous food! Perfect place to go with friends or a casual date! Go, go, go!
author: Kristen M.

description:
This is probably my most favorite restaurant in SF! It just opened and it's amazing! It has great prices! Amazing food! Great service! And in a beautiful area. 

First off, the bread is amazing and they get it fresh every morning! I had the entree with shrimp, clams, and muscles and it was the best seafood dinner I've ever had! 

I highly recommend this restaurant because it's hassle free, plenty of parking, and great food! How could you go wrong??
author: Sohab M.

description: Never had better Italian food..Try their Gamberi...its to die for. John the server is very knowledgeable and nice.
author: Shawn S.

description: Great food! Love the lunch specials - only $12. Authentic Italian cuisine at reasonable prices. Cute ambience.
author: Ang C.

description: I ordered from Vixi Cucina Italiana via Ubereats and was excited to do so because of the high ratings. I ordered a lasagna and was expecting something like the photos in other reviews. But when it arrived the dish really didn't look anything like that and didn't taste too great either. There was barely any filling and a ton of sauce. Wish I could rate this place higher...
author: Supriya G.

description: I loved the ravioli. The lemonade was good and thank you for the extra bread while we were waiting for the main course.
author: Selene N.

description: I highly recommend this neighborhood gem.  We were staying in Presidio Heights and vacationing from out of town.  We happened upon this restaurant and from the moment we stepped in we knew this was going to be great. Comfortable vibe and the owner greeted our family and recommended some excellent dishes for my wife and I and our kids.  He also gave us a three bottle wine tasting to choose from which was awesome.  The staff was positive and friendly and made the experience so enjoyable.
author: Todd H.

description: Delicious food, great service.  Highly recommended.  Try Frutti Dimar, you'll love it!  No wait and food is served fast.
author: Irma L R.

description: This restaurant is a winner!  We enjoyed a nice dinner with wine, salad, delicious pasta and were too full for dessert.  The ingredients are top quality and the preparation was excellent.  This is not a boring mediocre Italian food spot - this is a really good, reasonably priced restaurant that should be full for lunch and dinner.  So if you are in the Laurel Heights area, you should stop in and give this place a try.  I really hope they succeed.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Three cheers for Erik, the manager during our recent visit!  We had a few minor problems for which he gave incredible attention resulting in our having a wonderful experience as well as an extraordinary meal!! Erik has won a blue ribbon from us! Special thumbs up for their minestrone soup!!  Dr.Joe and Marcia
author: Joseph K.

description: have only ordered through UberEats a couple of times and was happy for the most part.  The pasta dishes (Cavatappi and Fettucini Funghi, in particular) are excellent, flavorful and rich.  The grilled chicken (Pollo Griglia) was more "well done" that I would have like.  The Pizza Margarita is just ok.  If you stick with the pasta dishes, you will have a good meal.
author: Hoa T.

description: The menu description for their Margarita pizza says "Simply tomato sauce with fresh mozzarella, finished with basil and olive oil"  Sounds pretty yummy, so I ordered one for lunch.  Opened the box to find this pizza had NOT ONE DROP of any tomato sauce.. no sauce at all.  It was just the cheese with a thin slice of a tomato laying on top of each slice. Then garnished with some basil shavings.  It wasn't gross, but it wasn't what the menu said it would be.  At all. Won't get pizza there ever again.  They should either change the menu description, or add sauce and remove the tomato slices.  (It's basically just a white pizza.)
author: Nic P.
